DataElement.preferredName: Notification Schedule Study Activity Ideal Date and Time Range ISO21090.IVL.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that represents the communication of a message to a recipient that is anticipated to occur at some time in the future and has been assigned a time or date when that activity is to be performed. The date and time span specifying when the activity was originally scheduled to begin and end. NOTE(S): This would be the date and time span based on applying the study calendar to a specific subject.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Notification Schedule Study Activity Ideal Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Informing by words.:An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Conforming to an ultimate standard of perfection or excellence.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Informing by words.:An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Conforming to an ultimate standard of perfection or excellence.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: Conforming to an ultimate standard of perfection or excellence.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Set of consecutive values of an ordered base datatype of the type TS.DATETIME.
